messages.title: Labour better for Bournemouth West
messages.content: I am very much a local candidate and proud of it. I went to St Andrews Primary and Beaufort Secondary Schools. My children all went to local schools. I did live and work overseas for 12 years, having spells in the Middle East, Australia and Africa, including 8 years in Malawi where I built dams and pipelines in remote areas. I returned to Bournemouth 17 years ago and now live near Castlepoint. I work for a local construction firm and I am active in my local Church. People deserve to be represented by a local candidate who is firmly rooted in this area and not a career politician.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in the NHS for the long term and reverse the creeping privatisation of this public service.
Labour will support sustainable apprenticeships that lead to high value jobs for our young people.
Protect pensions and defend public services for all senior citizens.
Labour will work to end the gender pay gap and improve opportunities in the workplace for women.
Only Labour will deliver a green economy for jobs and a better environment.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Labour can defeat the Tories here in Bournemouth West.

issues.environment: Only Labour will deliver a green economy for jobs and a better environment.
issues.health: Invest in the NHS for the long term and reverse the creeping privatisation of this public service.
